headline.main: Obama Picks Frieden to Lead the C.D.C.

docs.abstract: Also in Morning Buzz: the reason behind the missing H train; a new swine flu outbreak; and other headlines from local papers.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama will announce on Friday that he has chosen Dr. Thomas R. Frieden, the New York City health commissioner, as the next director of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. Dr. Frieden, a 48-year-old infectious disease specialist, has led an aggressive crusade to reduce smoking in New York, pushed for having calories listed in fast-food establishments, and done earlier work to stop a growing epidemic of drug-resistant tuberculosis infections. Recently, he also won positive reviews himself for his televised swine flu updates.
